intro: Gymnosporia wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of alpine flora.
